title: petsc build error after update to hdf5 1.12
body:
### Spack version
Current `develop` branch.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install petsc@3.7.7 ^superlu_dist@5.1.3_
```
(The `superlu_dist` version is required until #15551 is merged, an related issue.)

leads to:
```console
/gpfs/alpine/fus123/proj-shared/kaig1/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-power9le/gcc-8.1.1/hdf5-1.12.0-env7kt2iczm4znpvefw4cqb6pbi767a3/include/H5version.h:746:23: error: too few arguments to function 'H5Oget_info3'
   #define H5Oget_info H5Oget_info3
                       ^~~~~~~~~~~~
/tmp/kaig1/spack-stage/spack-stage-petsc-3.7.7-v2q6fsmywzszwwjov2nog6fppzwujepz/spack-src/include/petscviewerhdf5.h:34:37: note: in definition of macro 'PetscStackCallHDF5'
     PetscStackPush(#func);_status = func args;PetscStackPop; if (_status) SETERRQ2(PETSC_COMM_SELF,PETSC_ERR_LIB,"Error in HDF5 call %s() Status %d",#func,(int)_status); \
                                     ^~~~
/tmp/kaig1/spack-stage/spack-stage-petsc-3.7.7-v2q6fsmywzszwwjov2nog6fppzwujepz/spack-src/src/sys/classes/viewer/impls/hdf5/hdf5v.c:729:24: note: in expansion of macro 'H5Oget_info'
     PetscStackCallHDF5(H5Oget_info,(obj, &info));
                        ^~~~~~~~~~~
```

This happens because of an incompatible API change in HDF5 1.12. It affects other packages, too, e.g., #15252.

I can see various options to work around this, ie., limiting hdf5 to :1.10.99, adding `-DH5_USE_110_API`, or updating the code to work with the new API, which in particular for old versions of petsc doesn't seem desirable.

@balay
